intro: Thlaspi dacicum subsp. banaticum, commonly known as the Banat thlaspi, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically features dark green, succulent leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in early summer. It is often found in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
